net.sf.rcer.conn.connections
Class ConnectionData

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.rcer.conn.connections.ConnectionData
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, IConnectionData
Direct Known Subclasses:
Connection
public class ConnectionData
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, IConnectionData

This class encapsulates a set of connection data used to connect to a SAP R/3 system.

Author:
vwegert

Constructor Summary
ConnectionData()
          Default constructor (creates a direct connection with dummy data).

Constructor Detail

ConnectionData

public ConnectionData()
Default constructor (creates a direct connection with dummy data).

ConnectionData

public ConnectionData(java.lang.String connectionDataID,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      java.lang.String systemID,
                      java.lang.String router,
                      java.lang.String applicationServer,
                      int systemNumber)
A constructor to create a direct connection.

Parameters:
connectionDataID - the ID of the connection
description - a human-readable description of the system connection
systemID - the system ID (SID) of the SAP R/3 system
router - the SAP router string
applicationServer - the address or name of the application server to use
systemNumber - the system number to use

ConnectionData

public ConnectionData(java.lang.String connectionDataID,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      java.lang.String systemID,
                      java.lang.String router,
                      java.lang.String messageServer,
                      int messageServerPort,
                      java.lang.String loadBalancingGroup)
A constructor to create a connection that uses load balancing.

Parameters:
connectionDataID - the ID of the connection
description - a human-readable description of the system connection
systemID - the system ID (SID) of the SAP R/3 system
router - the SAP router string
messageServer - the address or name of the message server to use
messageServerPort - the port of the message server to use
loadBalancingGroup - the name of the group used for load balancing

                                int systemNumber)
Sets the parameters for a direct connection.

Parameters:
applicationServer - the address or name of the application server to use
systemNumber - the system number to use

                                       int messageServerPort,
                                       java.lang.String loadBalancingGroup)
Sets the parameters for a load balancing connection.

Parameters:
messageServer - the address or name of the message server to use
messageServerPort - the port of the message server to use
loadBalancingGroup - the name of the group used for load balancing

getConnectionDataID

public java.lang.String getConnectionDataID()
Specified by:
getConnectionDataID in interface IConnectionData
Returns:
the ID of the connection data set. Note that this is NOT the ID of the actual connection.

getConnectionType

public ConnectionType getConnectionType()
Specified by:
getConnectionType in interface IConnectionData
Returns:
the connection type. If a direct connection is used, an application server and a system number must be provided. If a messages server is used, the message server, the port and the group name must be provided.

isDirectConnection

public boolean isDirectConnection()
Specified by:
isDirectConnection in interface IConnectionData
Returns:
true if the connection is a direct connection, false if load balancing is used.
See Also:
IConnectionData.getConnectionType()

isLoadBalancedConnection

public boolean isLoadBalancedConnection()
Specified by:
isLoadBalancedConnection in interface IConnectionData
Returns:
true if load balancing is used, false if the connection is a direct connection.
See Also:
IConnectionData.getConnectionType()
